definition: to join/to fit/to mate/to mix/to match/to deserve/to make up (a prescription)/to allocate
to/for/for the benefit of/to give/to allow/to do sth (for sb)/(grammatical equivalent of 被)/(grammatical equivalent of 把)/(sentence intensifier)

sentences.english: They eked out the oil stores by strict rationing.
sentences.chinese: 他们采取严格的配给措施以延长储油的使用时间。

sentences.english: Her parents betrothed her to the boy of the neighboring village.
sentences.chinese: 她父母在她年幼时就把她许配给邻村的一个小男孩。

sentences.english: Old women were rationed to 14 kilograms of grain a month.
sentences.chinese: 对老年妇女每个月配给粮食14公斤。

sentences.english: Cotton and cloth are being rationed out now.
sentences.chinese: 棉花和棉布现在正实行定量配给。

sentences.english: The lady assured to him her daughter.
The old rascal has promised his daughter to a cousin of the Seixas.
sentences.chinese: 那个老混蛋，把女儿许配给了赛克萨斯家的一个表亲。

sentences.english: The holding-down and knock-over sinkers (5) do not require dedicated drives and box cams.
sentences.chinese: 退圈和脱圈沉降片不需要配给驱动装置和箱式凸轮。

sentences.english: A cost in tokens is assigned to each programme offered in Tokens PPV mode.
sentences.chinese: 令牌费用被指配给令牌PPV模式所提供的各个程序。

sentences.english: He betrothed his daughter to a rich man.
sentences.chinese: 他把他的女儿许配给一个有钱人。

sentences.english: There was a grave food shortage in Anatolia, and bread was put on ration.
sentences.chinese: 在安纳托利亚有严重的食物短缺，面包是定量配给的。

sentences.english: China's credit rationing creates distortions in the price of capital.
sentences.chinese: 中国的信贷配给造成了资本价格的扭曲。

sentences.english: To give the saree as pillow to thy head.
sentences.chinese: 惨白，不配给你当偎依的枕头。

sentences.english: Already, as the World Food Program's stocks were running low, rations had been halved.
sentences.chinese: 世界粮食计画库存渐少，粮食配给早已开始减半。

sentences.english: Rationing anything creates distortions in the price.
sentences.chinese: 何东西实施配给就会造成价格扭曲。

sentences.english: With these words, the king gave the princess to the leap frog.
sentences.chinese: 国王因为这一点，将女儿许配给了跳蛙。

definition: to serve as/to be a substitute for
to issue/to distribute/to publish along with
funds and provisions for the troops/(soldier's) pay
